newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 2.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 2.

text.p: * Engelhard Corp said it expects third quarter earnings below analysts' estimates and fourth quarter earnings in line with the first half. Shares closed Tuesday at 23-3/8.
* Foundation Health Corp and Health Systems International Inc said they agreed to a stock-swap merger valued at about $3 billion. Foundation closed at 34 and Health Systems closed at 28-3/4.
* Timeline Inc said it does not expect to post break-even results until the second half of fiscal 1997. Shares closed at 5-1/8.
* United Dominion Realty Trust Inc said it agreed to acquire South West Property Trust for $312 million in stock. United Dominion closed at 14-1/8. South West closed at 13-7/8.
* Remedy Corp declared a two-for-one stock split and said its third quarter results would exceed estimates. Shares closed at 78-1/2.
* Intelligent Medical Imaging said its 1996 results will be below estimates. Shares closed at 14-1/4.
* Open Plan Systems Inc said its third quarter earnings will be below expectations. Shares closed at 10-1/4.
* Expert Software Inc said it expects a third quarter operating loss. Shares closed at 6-7/8.
* Software 2000 Inc said it expects fourth quarter results below expectations. Shares closed at 10.
* Mark IV Industries Inc said it would restructure, cut about 1,000 jobs and post a third quarter charge of $1.04 per share. Shares closed at 21-5/8.
